_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Introduction
Hawkins, Inc. was founded in 1938 and is a progressive business that supplies chemicals, delivery systems and expertise to improve the environment.  We create alternative solutions for delivery and assist customers in creating new offerings across many markets.  Our traditional focus has been on the sale, delivery and safe handling of bulk chemicals.  Today, Hawkins is becoming more specialized by working with customers with very exacting specifications seeking appropriate and innovative alternatives to meet their needs.

Hawkins in based in Roseville, Minnesota with branches throughout the United States.  The Hawkins Water Treatment Group (HWTG) provides water and waste-water treatment equipment and chemicals to improve the quality of life and operate in concert with the environment.  Hawkins also serves regional customers in the Industrial sector in the fields of energy, electronics, chemical processing, pulp and paper, medical devices and metal finishing.  Food manufacturers, processing plants, and pharmaceutical concerns across the nation benefit from Hawkins' chemical distribution, blending and related expertise.

Hawkins' mission is to exceed our customers' expectations as a high-quality, service-oriented chemical supplier.  We adapt quickly to the changing chemical needs of customers with a keen focus on technical expertise, teamwork, safety, profitability, and responsible care of the environment and of our community.

Executive Summary 
Prevention and Emergency Response policies:  Hawkins' management has set a motto of "Think Safe! Be Safe!" regarding accidents and injuries.  Support for this motto is manifested in several ways such as:
1. A corporate Health, Safety and Environmental (HSE) department staffed with trained professionals.
2. Training programs in chemical safety, safe material handling, accident prevention and emergency response.
3. Prompt investigation of near misses and incidents to identify root causes and implement measures to p

revent future occurrences.
4. Adherence to all EPA and OSHA regulations governing our operations.
5. Compliance with DOT requirements regarding shipping and materials.
6. Internal and 3rd party audits of Health, Safety and Environmental procedures at all Hawkins locations.
7. Members in good standing with the Chlorine Institute and the National Association of Chemical Distributors.

Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled:  The Hawkins Water Treatment Group - Memphis Facility is a chemical distribution warehouse that stores and distributes several materials used to protect public health by treating water, wastewater, swimming pools and other uses.  The products covered in our Risk Management Plan for this facility are chlorine and sulfur dioxide (anhydrous).   The covered process consists of container transfer and storage of those containers.  This site does not manufacture, package or use chlorine or sulfur dioxide on site.

Prevention Program:  Accident prevention is achieved through handling procedures that properly protect chemicals during shipping and storage.  This starts with DOT approved containers that are robustly designed to contain chemicals through all conditions expected during processing as well as mishandling that could cause a container to fall or shift during transport.  It continues through having employees trained in proper handling procedures and equipping them with equipment to safely move chemicals during storage and transportation.  Adherence to OSHA workplace rules is just another part of our safety program.  We also follow industry standards, such as those of the Chlorine Institute, to ensure that our equipment and procedures are protective of the health and safety of our employees, the environment, and the surrounding community.

5-Year Accident History:  There has not been an accident involving chlorine or sulfur dioxide (anhydrous) at this facility in the last 5 years.

Emergency Response:  In the event of a chlorine or sulfur

dioxide (anhydrous) release, Hawkins Water Treatment Group employees are trained to investigate the situation and if needed:
1. Call the local fire department for hazmat assistance.
2. Evacuate to a safe distance.  
The local fire department has toured the facility and is aware of the chemicals on site.  In order to help assist the local fire department, Hawkins has a special recovery vessel on site in which a leaking 150-pound or smaller cylinder can be inserted to contain any further release.

Planned Changes:  While Hawkins desires to continually improve safety, there are no specific changes planned at this time.  We will strive to continue to stay compliant to industry standards and government regulations and our own commitment to "Think Safe! Be Safe!".
